values.description: Allow remote protocol in from all locations
values.name: allow_remote_22_in_all

values.description: Allow remote protocol in from all locations
values.name: allow_remote_3389_in_all

after.description: Allow remote protocol in from all locations
after.name: allow_remote_22_in_all

after.description: Allow remote protocol in from all locations
after.name: allow_remote_3389_in_all

availability_set_id.description: id of the availability set where the vms are provisioned.

network_interface_ids.description: ids of the vm nics provisoned.

network_interface_private_ip.description: private ip addresses of the vm nics

network_security_group_id.description: id of the security group provisioned

network_security_group_name.description: name of the security group provisioned

public_ip_address.description: The actual ip address allocated for the resource.

public_ip_dns_name.description: fqdn to connect to the first vm provisioned.

public_ip_id.description: id of the public ip address provisoned.

description.constant_value: Allow remote protocol in from all locations

admin_password.description: The admin password to be used on the VMSS that will be deployed. The password must meet the complexity requirements of Azure

admin_username.description: The admin username of the VM that will be deployed

allocation_method.description: Defines how an IP address is assigned. Options are Static or Dynamic.

boot_diagnostics_sa_type.description: (Optional) Storage account type for boot diagnostics

custom_data.description: The custom data to supply to the machine. This can be used as a cloud-init for Linux systems.

delete_os_disk_on_termination.description: Delete datadisk when machine is terminated

enable_accelerated_networking.description: (Optional) Enable accelerated networking on Network interface

enable_ssh_key.description: (Optional) Enable ssh key authentication in Linux virtual Machine

is_windows_image.description: Boolean flag to notify when the custom image is windows based.

nb_data_disk.description: (Optional) Number of the data disks attached to each virtual machine

nb_instances.description: Specify the number of vm instances

nb_public_ip.description: Number of public IPs to assign corresponding to one IP per vm. Set to 0 to not assign any public IP addresses.

public_ip_dns.description: Optional globally unique per datacenter region domain name label to apply to each public ip address. e.g. thisvar.varlocation.cloudapp.azure.com where you specify only thisvar here. This is an array of names which will pair up sequentially to the number of public ips defined in var.nb_public_ip. One name or empty string is required for every public ip. If no public ip is desired, then set this to an array with a single empty string.

remote_port.description: Remote tcp port to be used for access to the vms created via the nsg applied to the nics.

resource_group_name.description: The name of the resource group in which the resources will be created

ssh_key.description: Path to the public key to be used for ssh access to the VM.  Only used with non-Windows vms and can be left as-is even if using Windows vms. If specifying a path to a certification on a Windows machine to provision a linux vm use the / in the path versus backslash. e.g. c:/home/id_rsa.pub

storage_account_type.description: Defines the type of storage account to be created. Valid options are Standard_LRS, Standard_ZRS, Standard_GRS, Standard_RAGRS, Premium_LRS.

tags.description: A map of the tags to use on the resources that are deployed with this module.

vm_os_id.description: The resource ID of the image that you want to deploy if you are using a custom image.Note, need to provide is_windows_image = true for windows custom images.

vm_os_offer.description: The name of the offer of the image that you want to deploy. This is ignored when vm_os_id or vm_os_simple are provided.

vm_os_publisher.description: The name of the publisher of the image that you want to deploy. This is ignored when vm_os_id or vm_os_simple are provided.

vm_os_simple.description: Specify UbuntuServer, WindowsServer, RHEL, openSUSE-Leap, CentOS, Debian, CoreOS and SLES to get the latest image version of the specified os.  Do not provide this value if a custom value is used for vm_os_publisher, vm_os_offer, and vm_os_sku.

vm_os_sku.description: The sku of the image that you want to deploy. This is ignored when vm_os_id or vm_os_simple are provided.

vm_os_version.description: The version of the image that you want to deploy. This is ignored when vm_os_id or vm_os_simple are provided.

vm_size.description: Specifies the size of the virtual machine.

vnet_subnet_id.description: The subnet id of the virtual network where the virtual machines will reside.

availability_set_id.description: id of the availability set where the vms are provisioned.

network_interface_ids.description: ids of the vm nics provisoned.

network_interface_private_ip.description: private ip addresses of the vm nics

network_security_group_id.description: id of the security group provisioned

network_security_group_name.description: name of the security group provisioned

public_ip_address.description: The actual ip address allocated for the resource.

public_ip_dns_name.description: fqdn to connect to the first vm provisioned.

public_ip_id.description: id of the public ip address provisoned.
